column2: GEORGIA DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Georgia

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column4: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 2. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
column6: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.

column2: 3. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column6: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column8: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column6: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column8: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.

column2: 5. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a narrow bridge ahead.
column8: a low place in the road.

column2: 6. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column4: respect the posted speed limit.
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Trucks merging from the right

column2: 8. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must not drive past this sign.
column8: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column6: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.

column2: 10. This road sign means the road you're driving on:
column4: turns sharply to the left and then right
column6: turns to the right and then the left

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: Road narrows ahead

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column6: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.

column2: 13. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: The same as a green light.
column8: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 14. This sign means:
column4: No parking on pavement.

column2: 15. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
column4: Destination signs (guide signs)

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: Wrong Way

column2: 17. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
column8: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
column4: Low shoulder

column2: 19. Roads are most slippery:
column4: when it stops raining.
column6: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 20. Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
column4: on the opposite side of the street.
column8: if you have the green light.

column2: 21. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column6: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.
column8: wait until traffic ahead is clear.

column2: 22. Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out of ordinary:
column4: improves traffic flow.

column2: 23. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.
column6: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column8: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.

column2: 24. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column4: green, yellow and red

column2: 25. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
column4: low-beam lights.

column2: 26. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column4: Before the stop line.

column2: 27. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column8: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 28. Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
column4: you are not wearing safety belts.
column6: you don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.
column8: you are following a bicyclist or motorcyclist across railroad tracks.

column2: 29. When changing lanes:
column4: look over your shoulder to make sure no one is in the blind spot.
column6: slow down and check your left mirror.
column8: change lane before checking the inside rearview mirror.

column2: 30. To make a proper right turn:
column4: swing to the left before turning right.
column6: give the proper signal and get into the lane nearest the right curb.
column8: slow down and get into the lane nearest the centerline.

column2: 31. Your car may hydroplane at speeds as low as:
column4: 35 MPH

column2: 32. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
column6: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column8: take their foot off the gas pedal.

column2: 33. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column6: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column8: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.

column2: 34. Collisions can happen more often when:
column4: all vehicles are traveling at the posted speed limit.
column6: one lane of traffic is traveling faster than the others.
column8: one vehicle is traveling faster than the flow of traffic.

column2: 35. At a stop sign there is no stop line, you must stop:
column4: before you enter the crosswalk.

column2: 36. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column8: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

column2: 37. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.

column2: 38. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who have overslept.
column8: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 39. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column6: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column8: can turn left. You have the right of way.

column2: 40. Seat belt use is not required:
column4: in emergency vehicles.
